intro: Sida virgata, commonly known as velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are often covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a velvety texture. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. Sida virgata is often found in disturbed soils and can become invasive in certain regions.
